question: Will @realDonaldTrump tweet by April 1?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Donald J. Trump's verified Twitter account (@realDonaldTrump) tweets at least once after February 14, 2023, and by April 1, 2023, (11:59:59 PM ET). Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The resolution source for this market will be Donald J. Trump's verified Twitter account: https://twitter.com/realdonaldtrump.

For the purpose of this market's resolution, retweets do not count as a tweet.

Please note, only the @realDonaldTrump verified Twitter account counts for this market, regardless of the URL for this profile. If Donald J. Trump tweets from another account, it has no bearing on the resolution of this market.

question: Will the Fed increase interest rates by 25 bps after its March meeting?
description:
The FED interest rates are defined in this market by the upper bound of the target federal funds range. The decisions on the target federal fund range are made by the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meetings.

The resolution source for this market is the FOMC’s statement after its meeting scheduled for March 21-22, 2023 according to the official calendar: https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomccalendars.htm.

This market will resolve to “Yes” if following the Federal Reserve's March 2023 meeting the upper bound of the target federal funds rate is increased exactly 25 basis points over the level it was prior to the meeting. Otherwise, it will resolve to “No.”

The level and change of the target federal funds rate is also published at the official website of the Federal Reserve at https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/openmarket.htm.

This market may resolve as soon as the FOMC’s statement for their March meeting with relevant data is issued. If no statement is released by April 30, 2023, 11:59:59 PM ET, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will PredictIt create a new market by March 31, 2023?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if PredictIt (https://www.predictit.org/) adds a new market which users are able to trade on by March 31, 2023, 11:59:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". 

Adding new outcomes to already existing markets will not count.

If PredictIt launches a new trading platform with at least one new market which accepts users' trades by March 31, 2023, 11:59:59 PM ET the market will also resolve to "Yes". This market cannot resolve to "No" until March 31, 2023, 11:59:59 PM ET has passed.

The primary resolution source for this market will be the markets page on PredictIt (https://www.predictit.org/markets/), however a consensus of credible sources may also be used.

question: NBA: Spurs vs. Hornets (02/15/2023)
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for February 15:

If the San Antonio Spurs win, the market will resolve to “Spurs”.

If the Charlotte Hornets win, the market will resolve to “Hornets”.

If this game is not completed by April 15, 2023 (11:59:59 PM ET), or is definitively cancelled before that date, this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: NBA Dailies (02/15/2023)
events.description: This is a market group for NBA games happening on 02/15/2023.

question: Will another flying object be downed by the U.S. on February 15?
description:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if another flying object over North America is reported destroyed or downed by the United States on February 15, 2023, between 12:00:00 AM ET and 11:59:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

This market will only resolve "Yes" if a new destruction or downing of a flying object is reported on within this market's timeframe, and the downing occurred within this market's timeframe. If  a flying object is destroyed/downed within the market's timeframe but is only reported on after this market's expiration, it will have no bearing on the resolution of this market - this market will immediately resolve to "No" if there are no reports by 11:59:59 PM ET.

The primary resolution source for this market will be official statements made by the government of the United States of America, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

question: Will the price of $BLUR be above $0.50 on February 28?
description:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if the Coinbase 1 minute candle for BLUR-USD titled 28 Feb '23 12:00 in the ET timezone (referring to 12:00 PM ET) has a final “Close” price of 0.5001 or higher, or to “No” otherwise.

The resolution source for this market is https://www.coinbase.com/, specifically the BLUR-USD “Close” prices currently available at https://www.coinbase.com/advanced-trade/BLUR-USD with “1m” and “Candles” selected on the top bar.

To see the “Close” prices, mouse over particular candles and look at the value after “C” at the top of the chart.

Please note that this market is about the price according to Coinbase BLUR-USD, not according to other sources or spot markets.
